title: YouTube for Android testing ‘Play something’ FAB - 9to5Google
summary:
YouTube for Android Testing New 'Play Something' Feature

Publication Date: November 16, 2024   Source: 9to5Google

YouTube is currently testing a new “Play something” floating action button (FAB) on its Android app, aimed at improving user engagement by initiating video playback based on user preferences.

  • The FAB features a prominent design with white text on a black background.
  • Tapping the button launches a video within the Shorts player, although it also accommodates regular content.
  • The button disappears when the miniplayer is activated.
  • This feature has been in testing since last year, with recent updates reflected in version 19.50 for Android.
“The use of a FAB is interesting, but does make thematic sense since it lets you initiate the main content consumption purpose of the app.”

This new feature reflects YouTube's ongoing efforts to enhance the user experience by allowing users to more easily discover and engage with content.
newTitle: YouTube for Android Testing New 'Play Something' Feature

title: Samsung Galaxy S25 Slim might use completely new camera technology for better periscope zoom - Notebookcheck.net

Publication Date: Not specified. Source: Not specified.

Samsung's new camera technology for the Galaxy S25 Slim promises significant improvements, reducing the periscope module's length by 22% while enhancing picture quality.

  • Camera module length reduced by 22% and height decreased, resulting in a smaller camera bump.
  • Improved brightness and an f/2.58 aperture at an equivalent focal length of 80mm.
  • Samsung forecasts sales of 3 million Galaxy S25 Slim units, lower than the anticipated 37 million for other S25 variants.
"Those expecting a decline in picture quality will also be pleasantly surprised."

This new technology may attract consumers looking for slim smartphones with advanced camera capabilities.

title: Just a fraction of the hydrogen hidden beneath Earth's surface could power Earth for 200 years, scientists find - Space.com
summary:
Hydrogen Reserves Beneath Earth Could Sustain Global Energy Needs for 200 Years

Publication Date: December 13, 2023
Source: Space.com

New research reveals that a vast quantity of hydrogen exists beneath Earth's surface, enough to significantly reduce reliance on fossil fuels for up to 200 years. This hydrogen, estimated at around 6.2 trillion tons, could play a crucial role in the transition to cleaner energy.

  • The planet holds approximately 6.2 trillion tons of hydrogen, located mainly in deep rocks and underground reservoirs.
  • This amount is roughly 26 times the current known oil reserves.
  • Just 2% of the identified hydrogen could meet global demand for hundreds of years.
  • Hydrogen can be a source of clean energy, supporting vehicles, industrial processes, and electricity generation.
"There's actually dozens of natural processes that are capable of generating hydrogen, but most of them generate very small amounts." – Geoffrey Ellis, U.S. Geological Survey

The study emphasizes the potential of natural hydrogen as a reliable energy source, though challenges remain in accessing these resources. As research progresses, geologists aim to pinpoint where these reserves are located.
newTitle: Hydrogen Reserves Beneath Earth Could Sustain Global Energy Needs for 200 Years

Publication Date: December 2024 | Source: India TV News

The article discusses how Zupee is transforming traditional Indian games into a modern digital platform that caters to a diverse audience while promoting Indian culture.

  • Zupee revitalizes traditional Indian games by making them accessible in interactive, digital formats.
  • The platform focuses on skill-based gaming, removing chance elements and encouraging strategic gameplay.
  • Zupee aims for inclusivity, attracting players of varying skill levels, including those from tier 2 and 3 cities.
  • By promoting games deeply rooted in Indian culture, Zupee enhances cultural awareness among millions of users.
  • Committed to responsible gaming, Zupee utilizes RNG certification and blockchain technology to ensure fair play.
  • With over 100 million registered users, Zupee is a leading platform in India’s skill-based gaming sector.
Zupee stands as a shining example of how technology can be harnessed to celebrate and preserve Indian cultural traditions while creating new and exciting entertainment experiences for the digital age.

Zupee is not just reshaping the gaming landscape; it's fostering a community that blends cultural heritage with modern gaming thrills, offering a unique experience for Indian gamers.

title: Google tightens ad policies to align with Search spam rules - MarTech
summary:
Google Tightens Ad Policies to Align with Search Spam Rules

Publication Date: March 2024 | Source: MarTech

Google has expanded its “Abusing the ad network” policy to disapprove ads linking to destinations penalized for violating its Search spam policies.

  • The policy automatically disapproves ads directing users to manually penalized websites.
  • This action links PPC performance to a site’s overall search health, affecting both organic and paid traffic.
  • It increases responsibilities for PPC and SEO managers to monitor Google Search Console closely.
  • Google aims to maintain a high-integrity digital ecosystem through these policy updates.
“This reinforces Google’s commitment to a high-integrity digital ecosystem.”

This policy update is essential for maintaining the quality of advertisements in relation to search engine integrity.
newTitle: Google Tightens Ad Policies to Align with Search Spam Rules

title: WhatsApp to stop supporting THESE Android and iPhones from 2025: Check affected devices - ET Now
summary:
WhatsApp to Stop Supporting Certain Android and iPhone Models from 2025

Updated Dec 26, 2024 20:37 IST

WhatsApp is set to discontinue support for older Android and iPhone devices beginning in 2025, affecting users with devices that cannot run the latest software.

  • Starting January 1, 2025, WhatsApp will not support Android devices running KitKat OS or older.
  • Affected Android devices include the Samsung Galaxy S3, Motorola Moto G (1st Gen), HTC One X, and several others.
  • iPhone users must upgrade by May 2025 to continue using WhatsApp, as support will end for devices operating on iOS 15.1 or lower.
  • This move aims to enhance security and app functionality as older devices cannot support new features effectively.
Meta explains, "without updates or security patches, these phones become more vulnerable to cyber threats."

Users with affected devices are encouraged to upgrade to newer models to continue using WhatsApp securely.
newTitle: WhatsApp to Stop Supporting Certain Android and iPhone Models from 2025

Quad rear cameras:

Battery and charging:

  • 5000mAh battery capacity
  • Supports 45W wired and wireless charging

S-Pen support:

title: OpenAI’s GPT-5 Development Has Reportedly Suffered a Data Shortage Setback - Gadgets 360
summary:
OpenAI’s GPT-5 Project Said to Be Delayed Due to Data Crunch

Date: Not specified Source: Gadgets360

OpenAI is reportedly facing delays in the development of its GPT-5 model, primarily due to training data shortages and high expenses related to the project. The AI model has been under development for over 18 months and is not yet ready for a profit.

  • OpenAI’s GPT-5 is codenamed Orion and is behind schedule.
  • The delays are attributed to insufficient training data and unexpected costs, with extensive training sessions costing around $500,000,000.
  • The model is currently only marginally better than existing OpenAI models.
  • Microsoft, OpenAI's major backer, is reportedly displeased with the delays, anticipating a mid-2024 release.
The expected cost of a six-month training session for GPT-5 is around $500 million.

In conclusion, the challenges faced by OpenAI in developing GPT-5 could significantly push back the timeline for its release, affecting its commercial viability and market expectations.
newTitle: OpenAI’s GPT-5 Development Delayed Due to Data Shortages and Costs

title: DeepSeek-V3 is Now The Best Open Source AI Model - AIM
summary:

DeepSeek, a Chinese AI research initiative, has unveiled DeepSeek-V3, their newest version featuring 671 billion parameters and exceptional training on 14.8 trillion tokens.

  • The model is backed by High-Flyer Capital Management.
  • DeepSeek-V3 has surpassed Meta’s Llama 3.1 model and is three times faster than its predecessor.
  • DeepSeek has published the model on GitHub, alongside a detailed technical paper.
  • Evaluation shows that DeepSeek-V3 performs comparably to closed-source models like GPT-4o.
  • API pricing remains competitive, with costs set at $0.27/million tokens for input and $1.10/million tokens for output.

DeepSeek is rapidly advancing in the open-source AI sector, providing affordable and competitive AI solutions.

title: AI told me to work out less and the results were a disaster - TechRadar
summary:
AI told me to work out less and the results were a disaster

Publication Date: N/A Source: TechRadar

The article explores a personal experience with the Push app, which uses AI to generate workout plans. After following the app's suggestion to reduce workout days from six to four, the author faced unexpected challenges and frustration.

  • The Push app was initially praised for its ability to track fitness goals and generate effective workout plans.
  • The author's experiment to reduce workout frequency aimed to enhance recovery but led to frustration and unmet expectations.
  • Transitioning to fewer workouts resulted in longer gym sessions that disrupted the established routine.
  • The author reflects on the importance of maintaining enjoyment and structure in fitness routines.
“I realized that I actually love having a reason to go to the gym every day.”

In conclusion, the experience highlights the significance of personal preferences in workout routines and the necessity for adaptability in fitness plans.
newTitle: AI Advised Reduced Workouts, Resulting in Dismal Experience

title: Samsung still working hard on the ‘zero-bezel’ iPhone display - SamMobile - Samsung news
summary:
Samsung still working hard on the 'zero-bezel' iPhone display

Publication Date: December 26, 2024

Source: SamMobile

Samsung Display continues to develop a 'zero-bezel' OLED panel for Apple’s iPhone, originally requested by Apple for a potential 2025 release; however, current projections suggest the technology may not be ready even by 2026.

  • Apple sources its OLED panels from Samsung and is exploring new designs for iPhones.
  • Samsung's proposed OLED displays would wrap around the device, eliminating bezels.
  • Technological advancements in adhesive and encapsulation are required to overcome challenges.
  • Korean media reports that Samsung's zero-bezel displays may debut on Galaxy phones before iPhones.
"With the current rate of progress, it's unlikely we'll see a zero-bezel iPhone even in 2026."

The development of the zero-bezel display is crucial for both Samsung and Apple, but delays may push the innovation further into the future.
